articles.title: NJDEP to amend coastal flood regulations
articles.author: Elizabeth Mehler
articles.summary: The New Jersey Department of Environmental Protection wants to adopt the revised set of the Resilient Environment and Landscapes (REAL) coastal flood rules proposed in 2024. The proposed changes reflect a projected four-foot sea-level rise by 2100, rather than the original five-foot rise. The changes include lowering the coastal zone flood-elevation, decreasing the height at which new development needs to be built from five feet of elevation to four feet, and creating a 'hardship exemption' for affordable housing projects in flood-prone areas.
